an10.47:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
an10.47:4.2: Then Mahāli the Licchavi went up to the Buddha,
an10.47:4.3: bowed, sat down to one side,
an10.47:4.5: “What is the cause, sir, what is the reason for doing bad deeds, for performing bad deeds?”
an10.47:4.6: “Greed is a cause, Mahāli, greed is a reason for doing bad deeds, for performing bad deeds.
an10.47:4.7: Hate is a cause of bad deeds …
an10.47:4.8: Delusion is a cause of bad deeds …
an10.47:4.9: Focusing your mind in the wrong way is a cause of bad deeds …
an10.47:4.10: A wrongly directed mind is a cause of bad deeds …
an10.47:4.11: This is the cause, Mahāli, this is the reason for doing bad deeds, for performing bad deeds.”
an10.47:5.1: “What is the cause, sir, what is the reason for doing bad deeds, for performing good deeds?”
an10.47:5.2: “Greed is a cause, Mahāli, greed is a reason for doing good deeds, for performing good deeds.
an10.47:5.3: Love is a cause of good deeds …
an10.47:5.4: Understanding is a cause of good deeds …
an10.47:5.5: Focusing your mind in the right way is a cause of good deeds …
an10.47:5.6: A rightly directed mind is a cause of good deeds …
an10.47:5.7: This is the cause, Mahāli, this is the reason for doing good deeds, for performing good deeds.
an10.47:5.8: If these ten things were not found in the world, we wouldn’t see either unprincipled and unethical conduct, or principled and ethical conduct.
an10.47:5.9: But since these ten things are found in the world, we see both unprincipled and unethical conduct, and principled and ethical conduct.”
